results.title: Abnormal behavior: a mental hospital (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Tom Lazarus, CRM Productions and Neil Reichline
results.brief_description: A series of doctor-patient interviews acquaint the viewer with the symptomatology of various types of schizophrenic disturbances. In an unusual sequence, a patient with paranoid tendencies is shown undergoing electro-convulsive therapy. The director of the hospital tells of the hospital’s goals in this and other forms of treatment.

results.title: Ablutions
results.brief_description: Ablutions is an interactive journey where the user controls the fate of a character in a world that consumes technology. Through exploring the narrative the user partakes in the experience of cleansing the self from everyday technology and its commodities; questioning the nature of our identity. By doing this, freedom is redefined. Once cleansed, the character recovers the lost items, discovering their meaning and importance.

results.title: Ablett: one special season
results.creator_credit: Australian Football Video, Dean Shiel and Stephen Phillips
results.brief_description: In one special season Gary Ablett redefined the way Australian Rules football’s rich history will judge him. Having set standards rarely matched by other players since his career began, Ablett’s 1993 was quite extraordinary - even for a man prone to producing the extraordinary. We follow Ablett’s path through the season, hear him speak on his performance and his place in the Geelong team and travel to Nauru with him as he umpires the local Grand Final. This is a fine tribute to one of the legends of the game.

results.title: Abilene Paradox (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Janice M Reynolds, CRM Productions and Peter Jordon
results.brief_description: Deals with the management of agreement in organisations. Illustrates that mismanaged agreement is as dangerous to organisational effectiveness as excessive conflict because it can lead to inappropriate goals.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Janice M Reynolds, CRM Productions and Peter Jordon

results.title: Abel Gance: yesterday and tomorrow = Abel Gance: hier et demain
results.creator_credit: Nelly Kaplan, Office de Documentation par Film, Q. Ciarlo, D Harispe, N. Kaplan and R. Picon-Borel
results.brief_description: Yesterday and Tomorrow is a French/English dubbed documentary which summarizes Abel Gance’s entire career, from his days working initially as an actor in the film industry, up until 1963, the year this program was made. The documentary shows excerpts of his films including shorts like “La Folie du Docteur Tube” (1915). It is narrated through “the words of Gance”, who explains how his career was plagued with tragedy and little recognition.

results.title: Abel Gance: the charm of dynamite
results.creator_credit: Barrie Gavin, Rath Films and Kevin Brownlow
results.brief_description: French film director Abel Gance made outstanding contributions to cinema history through the innovations contained in his films. This film showcase these innovations, which include distorting the image, hand-held camera, dollying and close-up, rapid cutting, multiple superimposition (up to sixteen images at one time), 3D, multiple split screen and Polyvision, a Cinerama prototype using three synchronized cameras. He even lodged a patent for Prospective Sound, which is the basis for what has become stereo sound. His Film “Napoleon” (1927), in particular, is an encyclopaedia of film techniques. “The Charm of Dynamite” uses sequences from “Napoleon” (1927), “La roue (1923) and “J’accuse” (1919) to show the genius of this man. This documentary narrated by Lindsay Anderson and directed by Kevin Brownlow also includes Abel Gance in interview and some amazing behind the scenes footage of the techniques used in making his films. Director and film historian Brownlow would later reconstruct “Napoleon” for a revival premiere in 1980.

results.title: Abel Gance: Hier et Demain
results.brief_description:
In this documentary narrated by Abel Gance and directed by his former assistant (and filmmaker) Nelly Kaplan, the great director reminisces about his career which started in the silent era. With ‘Mater Dolorosa’ (1917) and especially ‘La dixieme symphonie’(1918), ‘J’accuse’ (1919) and ‘La roue’ (1921-23), Gance became a leading member of the French avant-garde. His work was characterised by dramatic excess (La dixieme symphonie), formal inventiveness (La roue), and technical innovation (split screens, complex camera movements, experiments with sound), all trends which find their apotheosis in ‘Napoleon vu par Abel Gance’ (1927), a five hour epic comparable to Griffith’s ‘The birth of a nation’ (1915) in its combination of reactionary ideology and formal brilliance.” Reference: Ginette Vincendeau. The companion to French cinema. BFI Publishing, 1996.

Credits: Director, Nelly Kaplan ; music, Michel Magne.

results.title: Abe Lincoln in Illinois
results.creator_credit: Max Gordon, RKO Radio Pictures and John Cromwell
results.brief_description: Adapted from the Pulitzer Prize-winning play by American author and playwright, Robert E. Sherwood, this film version captures the essence and fervour of one of America’s most memorable periods in its founding history. It takes a biographical slice of time out of Abraham Lincoln’s (Raymond Massey) life beginning with his early adult years as a woodsman, to his courtships first with Ann Rutledge (Mary Howard) and then with Mary Todd (Ruth Gordon), his eventual wife, through to years of law practice and finally to his election as President and the Declaration of Independence. Cast also includes Gene Lockhart, Howard da Silva and Alan Baxter.

results.title: ABC for kids: bumper collection
results.brief_description: A collection of children’s classic television for the very young to enjoy. “Invisible Bananas” and “Teddy chase”, the lovable Bananas In Pyjamas have fun with the teddies in these two episodes. “Postman Pat and the suit of armour”, Postman Pat helps get Garner Hall ready to be open to the public. “The Kite”, Brum the little car helps to rescue a runaway kite. “Where’s Spot?” and “Spot follows his nose”, little Spot the dog hides from his mum and looks for something that smells nice in these two episodes. “Thomas comes to breakfast” and “Four Little Engines”, Thomas the Tank Engine and Friends get up to mischief in these two episodes. “Hey hey Blinky Bill”, “Whistle Song” and “Earthquake”, two songs with Blinky Bill followed by an episode about his gang getting stuck in an old mine. “Pingu as chef” and “Pingu as baby sitter”, enjoy Pingu the penguin’s adventures as he pops popcorn and then looks after twin babies in these two episodes. “Party at Owl’s House”, join in the party with Little Bear and his friends as they have a “because” party.
